ranked_diseases.explanation: Aicardi-Goutières syndrome is associated with cerebral calcification, hydrocephalus, and cerebral hemorrhage. It often involves brain structural abnormalities which can include dilated ventricles.
COL4A1-related disorders can present with cerebral hemorrhage, dilated ventricles, and sometimes hydrocephalus. Mutations affect blood vessel integrity, leading to hemorrhages and calcifications.
This condition involves cerebral calcifications and may result in structural brain changes including ventricular enlargement and hydrocephalus.
L1 syndrome can feature hydrocephalus with aqueductal stenosis and dilated ventricles, and is associated with various central nervous system abnormalities.
Cockayne syndrome can involve intracranial calcifications and sometimes present with hydrocephalus or cerebral hemorrhage as part of its neurological manifestations.
